{"step_by_step_thinking": "The 95% confidence interval in clinical trials is used to estimate the range within which the true population parameter lies with a 95% probability. It is used to assess both the efficacy and non-efficacy of the drug. If the confidence interval includes the null value (usually 0 or 1), it indicates non-efficacy of the drug. If the confidence interval does not include the null value, it indicates efficacy of the drug.", "answer_choice": "C"}
